result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. David Louise Strong

records.addlTxt:
Defendant David Louise Strong appeared by video, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for David Louise Strong.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Bail/Bond hearing. Court reviewed State' Motion to Modify Bail/Bond. Discussion placed on the record. State complied with Victim Notification. Arguments heard regarding bail. For reasons stated on the record, Court GRANTED State's Motion to Modify Bail/Bond. No Contact with LBG (03/17/1965) and Sabrina C. (co-actor) Case adjourned for Plea/Sentencing, Branch 2. Plea/Sentencing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
No Contact Order signed and filed.

Defendant David Louise Strong not in court, in custody.  Attorney Connor Romenesko in court for David Louise Strong.  Attorney Grace M. Gall in court for State of Wisconsin. 
CASE HELD OFF THE RECORD PER JUDGE.  Case in court for scheduling conference.  Parties request a hearing on the no contact order and plea/sentencing date.  Court set dates as requested.  Case adjourned to Branch 40.
Bail/bond hearing scheduled for September 9, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for December 2, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Received and filed; forwarded to the Judge for review.

Defendant David Louise Strong in court with Attorney Connor Romenesko; both appear by video.  Defendant David Louise Strong in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 40, Judge Shelton. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 40.  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Attorney Connor Romenesko in court by video, defendant David Louise Strong not in court, in custody.  Gregg Herman appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. The defendant is housed at MSDF and not scheduled to appear by video for todays proceedings. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 2, 2022 at 10:30 am.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  Defendant to be monitored by portable breathalyzers.  Defendant to be monitored by drug testing.

Defendant David Louise Strong in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant David Louise Strong in custody.  Dennis Patrick Murphy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  David Louise Strong appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Shelton, Branch 40. Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 6, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for David Louise Strong
Current: 3357 South 84th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53227   (Effective: 06-21-2022)
Prior: 3370 South 85th Street, Milwaukee, WI 53227
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.

Arrest Warrant received from the D.A.'s office on filing date of Criminal Complaint.
